newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Win Win in talks on possible acquisition.
newsitem.headline: Win Win in talks on possible acquisition.

text.p: Textile machinery distributor Win Win International Holdings Ltd said it was in discussions which might lead to a possible acquisition designed to expand the existing scope of the company's businesses.
"However, no agreement has yet been reached as to the terms of the proposals," the company said in a statement on Tuesday.

The company also said its directors were still considering "whether or not to exercise the option" which gave the company the option of disposing certain of its trading businesses for at least HK$65 million prior to November 9, 1996.
The option was granted to the company by one its major shareholders, Savio Lam Holdings Corp, and a former director Daniel Lam in July 1995, it said.
Win Win shares rose HK$0.08 or 11.11 percent to HK$0.80 at midday with 78,000 shares traded.
